newsitem.title: UK: LCE white sugar ends down as October expiry nears.
newsitem.headline: LCE white sugar ends down as October expiry nears.

text.p: White sugar futures fell in heavy Wednesday trading, as players continued to sell spot October ahead of the contract's expiry on Friday.
Open interest has been rapidly increasing in both the December and March contracts as traders roll forward October positions through switch dealings.
Turnover on Wednesday was concentrated on the October and December contracts, which between them accounted for the bulk of the day's 5,321 lots traded.
Traders said the expiry might produce some more offtake and market interest once October deliveries were out of the way.
At 1730 GMT October and December were both hovering around intraday lows.
October was $3.50 lower at $345.20 a tonne while December lost $3.50 to $342.50.
Paris positions were also lower, with October off 50 cents at $348.50 and December down $3.00 at $343.00. Matif volume totalled 1,317 lots.
